fixes.name: Date Filter End Date
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR endDateParam = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date Exclude] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
        1,
        0
    ),
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = endDateParam,
        1,
        0
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the nested Tableau IF with parameter references to DAX using SELECTEDVALUE for each parameter. All column references were transformed to the 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Column] format. The logic preserves the original branching: when the Use Custom Date parameter is true, compare Max Date Exclude to EFFECTIVE_DATE; otherwise compare EFFECTIVE_DATE to the End Date parameter.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references parameters ([Parameters].[Use Custom Date] and [Parameters].[End Date]); per rules, any calculation using parameters must be created as a measure.
